step1.sentence: The policy introduced significant changes to how data was handled across the organization.

step2.story: The significant change in her perspective had not come from a single event but from an accumulation of small observations over three years that finally arranged themselves into a different picture. She could not point to the moment it happened — only to the morning she realized it already had.

step3.story: The CEO had announced that significant change was coming to the organizational structure without providing specifics, in an attempt to prepare people without causing premature alarm. The effect was the opposite: in the absence of specifics, the rumor mill provided its own specifics, each version more dramatic than the last. By the time the actual changes were announced three weeks later, they were more modest than almost any version that had circulated. The lesson was durable: when significant change is coming, vagueness does not reduce anxiety. It amplifies it.
